intro: Alcmene, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mallows, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants typically have heart-shaped leaves and produce showy, pink or purple flowers. Alcmene species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
